{"step_by_step_thinking": "OKC stands for Odontogenic Keratocyst. It is a type of cyst that occurs in the jaw and is associated with the development of teeth. There are different types of OKC based on the type of keratinization, which is the process of cells in the epithelium becoming filled with keratin. The types include orthokeratinized, parakeratinized, and non-keratinized. The aggressiveness and recurrence potential of OKC is generally associated with the type of keratinization. Among these, parakeratinized OKC is known to be more aggressive and has a higher recurrence potential.", "answer_choice": "B. Parakeratinized"}
